title: Six Takeaways From the Senate Deal to End the Shutdown
summary: For 40 days, Senator Chuck Schumer kept his caucus unified. But an end approached without Democrats achieving an extension of expiring health insurance subsidies.

title: A Breakthrough Government Shutdown Vote, and New Tax Cuts for the Ultrarich
summary: Plus, a house-size spider web.

title: Trump Pardons Giuliani and Others Involved in Effort to Overturn 2020 Election
summary: The pardons of former Trump aides, which would only apply in federal court, are largely symbolic and cannot shield them from ongoing state-level prosecutions.

title: BBC Director Tim Davie and CEO Deborah Turness Quit Following Trump Documentary Turmoil
summary: The abrupt moves followed furor over claims that a documentary had misleadingly edited footage of President Trump’s speech before the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.

title: Unwed Mothers and Their Children Are Trapped in Saudi Arabia
summary: A Times investigation found that children are routinely deprived of birth certificates, medical care and education. Diplomats and police officers turned the mothers away.

title: Why Children of Unmarried Mothers Are Stranded in Saudi Arabia
summary: We pieced together the details, from Riyadh to Nairobi.

title: Who Will Be Mamdani’s City Council Partner? Get Ready for a Battle.
summary: The heated contest to become City Council speaker took shape in Puerto Rico, where the leading contenders jockeyed for votes at a beachside political gathering.

title: Prosecutor Who Quit Over Adams Case Joins a Firm Known for Independence
summary: Danielle Sassoon resigned as an interim U.S. attorney rather than halt the prosecution of Mayor Eric Adams. Her new firm’s conservative principles have at times put it at odds with President Trump.

title: As the Russia War Continues, Ukraine Faces a Major Draft Evasion Problem
summary: Ukraine faces a major draft evasion problem, but no place is quite like Vylkove, a Danube River town where men of draft age have all but vanished, many of them trying to avoid military service.

title: R.F.K. Allies Embrace ‘Anti-Vax’ Label They Once Rejected
summary: A weekend gathering in Texas drew activists, homeopaths, doctors, lawyers, parents and a Republican senator who asked, “Why isn’t Tony Fauci in prison?”

title: Why Everyone Wants to Meet the ‘World’s Most Boring Man’
summary: Politicians, oil giants and climate activists hang on his every word. The Trump administration has blasted him. How did Fatih Birol get so big?

title: Prison Guards Shaved His Dreadlocks. The Supreme Court Will Decide if He Can Sue.
summary: Lower courts condemned the treatment of Damon Landor, a Rastafarian, but found that a federal law protecting religious rights barred him from suing prison officials for money.

title: Democrat’s Win May Upend a Conservative Push in Virginia Universities
summary: Supporters of Abigail Spanberger, Virginia’s governor-elect, say they expect her to reverse efforts to impose conservative priorities on the state’s prestigious public university system.

title: Federal Cuts, Immigration Raids and a Slowing Economy Hit Rural Libraries
summary: Like many rural small towns, Tieton, Wash., is facing a confluence of circumstances that has made keeping its one-room library, a “civic symbol” for the town, untenable.

title: Glass Skin and Snail Mucin: South Korea’s Journey to Global Beauty Power
summary: Propelled by interest in all things South Korea, Amorepacific, the cosmetics giant, is expanding its reach into the United States. But so are many of its competitors.

title: A Force Behind Timothée Chalamet, Charli XCX & Other Megastars of the Moment
summary: Timothée Chalamet, Charli XCX and Billie Eilish are among those who trust Aidan Zamiri, a director and photographer, with their images.

title: We’re In a New Everything-Is-Connected Epoch. But What to Call It?
summary: We have arrived at a “Polycene” moment where binary systems are giving way to multiple interconnected ones.

title: Democrats Were on a Roll. Why Stop Now?
summary: This is how the shutdown ends?

title: Juan Gabriel Tribute Draws Tens of Thousands to Mexico City
summary: The transgressive icon of Mexican music, who died in 2016, still has millions of fans. On Saturday, more than 170,000 filled Mexico City’s central plaza to watch footage of a landmark concert.

title: Lenny Wilkens, N.B.A. Hall of Famer as Both Player and Coach, Dies at 88
summary: A perennial All Star, he was cited as one of the league’s 50 greatest players and one of its top 10 coaches, winning 1,332 games and leading Seattle to a championship.

title: Medical Marijuana Grower in New Zealand Faces Criminal Charges
summary: A police raid and criminal case against a longtime cultivator of cannabis in New Zealand’s Northland region has stirred up debates about medicinal marijuana.

title: Jonathan Braun, Felon Freed by Trump, to Be Sentenced Again in Brooklyn
summary: A judge found that Jonathan Braun had violated the rules of his release by sexually assaulting a nanny, swinging an IV pole at a nurse and dodging tolls in his Lamborghini and Ferrari.
